intro: Finetia falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved finetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits. Finetia falcata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
